item.title: Omega-3 Fatty Acids a Game-Changer for ALS
item.description: New research conducted at Harvard University has found that omega-3 fatty acids could potentially be a game-changer in the treatment of Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS), a debilitating neurodegenerative disease. ALS, also known as Lou Gehrig’s disease, is characterized by the progressive degeneration of motor neurons in the brain and spinal cord, leading to muscle weakness, paralysis, and eventually death.
